dcterms:creator: B. Augsburg
R. De Haas
H. Harmgart
C. Meghir
dcterms:description: A microcredit experiment conducted in Bosnia and Herzegovina targeting 1,196 loan applicants who were marginally rejected by a microfinance institution, with 628 of these applicants randomly selected for a typical loan. The study examines the impacts of microcredit on various outcomes such as loan take-up, self-employment, and household business activities.
dcterms:title: Microcredit Experiment in Bosnia and Herzegovina
